name.str_pl: copies of The Compiled Notes of H.

description: A handwriting with an air of nobility and flourish dot the pages of this emaciated tome. It appears to have been penned by an individual whose name starts with an H. The exquisite cursive provides a sharp dissonance to the actual contents of the work however, as it seems to be sprawling with forgotten folklore and dubious mysteries.

name.str_pl: copies of Accursed Dreams of H.

description: A handwriting with an air of nobility and flourish dot the pages of this emaciated tome. It appears to have been penned by an individual whose name starts with an H. The exquisite cursive provides a sharp dissonance to the actual contents of the work however, as it seems to be sprawling with dreary landscapes of insufferable horrors and nightmares too convoluted to explain.

name.str_pl: copies of The Apotheosis of Hieronymous

description: A handwriting with an air of triumph and excellence decorate the pages of this extravagant tome. It appears to have been penned by an individual styled as Hieronymous. The exquisite cursive provides a startling insight into the actual contents of the work, as it closely resembles a holy scripture you would find in a sacred sanctuary or coven.

Hazy details concerning beings such as 'The Crippled God,' 'Hegemon,' 'Lord of Radiance,' and 'Empyrean' fill the innumerable landscape of this monumental codex. At the back, there is an entire section spanning dozens of pages dedicated to honoring the contributers of this enlightened work. Strangely, every single name is crossed out, leading to only a single name being legible. Lord Ruler.
